t: For the director of music. To the tune of “The Lily of the Covenant.” A miktam of David. For teaching. When he fought Aram Naharaim and Aram Zobah, and when Joab returned and struck down twelve thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.
You*pn have rejected us, God, and burst upon us; you*ld have been angry—now restore us!
You*ln have shaken the land and torn it open; mend*ld its fractures, for it is quaking.
You*ln have shown your people desperate times; you*ld have given us wine that makes us stagger.
But*ln for those who fear you, you have raised a banner to*ld be unfurled against the bow.
Save*pn us and help us with your right hand, that*ld those you love may be delivered.
God*ln has spoken from his sanctuary: “In*ld triumph I will parcel out Shechem and*ld measure off the Valley of Sukkoth.
Gilead*ln is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim*ld is my helmet, Judah*ld is my scepter.
Moab*ln is my washbasin, on*ld Edom I toss my sandal; over*ld Philistia I shout in triumph.”
Who*pn will bring me to the fortified city? Who*ld will lead me to Edom?
Is*ln it not you, God, you who have now rejected us and*ld no longer go out with our armies?
Give*ln us aid against the enemy, for*ld human help is worthless.
With*ln God we will gain the victory, and*ld he will trample down our enemies.
